p.s: The given text is from the novel The Hate U Give.
In this part Starr visits a Black Lives Matter protest with her half-brother Seven, Khalil's brother DeVante and her boyfriend Chris.
The children meet Ms. Ofrah there who is an activist for black power movements.
Ms. Ofrah stands on top of a police car and screams into the crowd.
When she saw Starr she came over to her.
Ms. Ofrah asks Starr what she is doing here.
Starr says that she wants to do somethign after the verdict of One-Fifteen is announced.
He is not guilty.
Ms. Ofrah reminds Starr about her biggest weapon.
Starr's biggest weapon is her voice.
Ms. Ofrah's coworker lifts Starr on the top of a cop car.
Starr turns to the crowd.
She is not sure what to say.
The police orders the crowd to exit but they do not listen to the police.
Starr takes the heavy bullhorn.
She starts saying who she is and what she saw while the incident.
Starr narrates her version of the story.
She and Khalil did not do anything wrong and they were assumed as criminals by One-Fifteen.
Starr judges Officer Cruise who should be guilty.
Now she turns to the cops and speakspeaks to them.
Starr says that all officers think people from Garden Heights must be bad.
She will keep protesting until the police overthinks their decisions.
At the end Starr points out that Khalil's life mattered and that the lived as a young teenager.
